subject: Sales
title: Mass Production Creates Mass Selling
description: A short lesson to help you apply Mass Production Creates Mass Selling.

hook.text: Henry Ford built cars so fast that his factory created a brand-new profession: the full-time salesperson.

buildup.text: Before factories, craftsmen sold their own work. Industrialization separated making from selling.

discovery.text: Suddenly there were more products than buyers. Companies needed dedicated staff to generate demand.

twist.text: Sales became a distinct career for the first time. Schools, training manuals, and forces emerged quickly.

climax.text: The Industrial Revolution didn't just change manufacturing. It invented modern selling as a profession.

punchline.text: Factories made the products. Salespeople made the demand.

quiz.question: How did mass production change selling?
options: It created the need for dedicated salespeople
Prices dropped so no selling was needed
